intro: Alpinia kelungensis, commonly known as the Hainan ginger, is a flowering plant native to southern China, particularly Hainan Island. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Alpinia kelungensis is often grown for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
